paper_abstract: This paper proposes a methodology for text mining relying on the classical knowledge discovery loop, with a number of adaptations. First, texts are indexed and prepared to be processed by frequent itemset levelwise search. Association rules are then extracted and interpreted, with respect to a set of quality measures and domain knowledge, under the control of an analyst. The article includes an experimentation on a real-world text corpus holding on molecular biology.
paper_title: Towards a text mining methodology using association rule extraction
